Which library is that? I have not experienced that problem myself.

One way around it could be to create an AllTests suite. It is easy with
dynamic suites in rMock: http://rmock.sourceforge.net/dynamicsuites.html
There are other similar tools.

That way you can create one root-suite that you can right-click and
run and all tests in your classes dir are found and run dynamically at
runtime. If you run that suite from Ant/Maven you can gurantee that
Ant/Maven run what you run when devel,oping and it is faster since it
does not need to fork a vm for each test.

I think right-clicking on the test souce-root rather than the project
and choose run-tests could also do the trick (not sure what you are
currently doing to run the tests).

Just some ideas and suggestions. I hope something helps.
/J
